ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Score: My first impressions of people usually turn out to be right
Notes: Participants response 1 through 4 is a score of 0. Participant response 5 is a score of 1. Scoring values of 0 or 1 are assigned to participants response on the scale of 1=Not true to 5=Very true.

ElementDescription: Impression Management Sub score
Notes: Sum of paulhus items 1-20

ElementDescription: Self-Deceptive Enhancement Sub score
Notes: Sum of paulhus items 21-40

ElementDescription: Paulhus Deception Scale Total
Notes: Sum of Impression Management sub score and Self-Deceptive Enhancement Sub score
